intro: Homalobus canovirens, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped, velvety leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or riverine habitats. Due to its nocturnal blooming habit, it is also known for its fragrant scent that attracts moths.
